data.title: Update MotionEvent.java
data.body:
Corrected minor spelling and class naming errors in JavaDoc comments.
forum post
https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/motionevent-doc-errors/37768

data.title: fix errors in how vector projection is calculated
data.body:
same diff I committed to 'master' on Jan 14, 2017
Without this change, the magnitude of the project() result is incorrect unless 'other' is a unit vector.

data.title: CapsuleCollisionShape: warn about scaling only if it's not identity
data.body:
same diff riccardobl committed to 'master' on Jun 20, 2016
Without this change, a warning is generated every time you construct a CylinderCollisionShape.

data.title: Potential Lighting issue with LWJGL_OPENGL3 renderer setting
data.body:
In TestPostFilter, when setting the renderer as LWJGL_OPENGL3 the signpost in the scene is completely black. This issue doesn't happen when the OPENGL2 renderer is used.
Note that the signpost displays fins with the opengl3 renderer in other tests like TestSpotLight.

data.title: Added options of shaders with GLSL150
data.body: Added options of shaders with GLSL150 to support OGL3 core profile on AMD cards.

data.title: Changed isUnitVector method on Vector3f to use lengthSquared
data.body: Currently, Vector3f's isUnitVector() method is using length() instead of lengthSquared(), thus, a useless sqrt calculation.

data.title: I use myeclipse developeï¼Œhow can i change?
jME 3.1 beta 2 installer does not observe destination folder correctly
data.body: Attempting to install jME 3.1 in the directory D:\3d\jmonkeyplatform_3_1 fails. The installer will install jME in D:\3d\jmonkeyplatform. The _3_1 suffix is ignored. Observed with the 3.1-beta2-b001-SNAPSHOT Windows x64 installer. The JME sdk 3.0.10 Windows x64 installer works correctly.

data.title: Bullet VehicleControl behaves differently in jME 3.1
data.body:
A Bullet vehicle that worked perfectly in jME 3.0, no longer works in jME 3.1. At least not in the most current beta of jME 3.1.

Versions used: 

JME sdk 3.0.10 (Windows x64)
jME 3.1-beta2-b001-SNAPSHOT (Windows x64)

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new project from the BasicGame template
2. Copy the files in the attached zip file to your project folder
3. Hit F6

Results:

- jME 3.0 - a controllable car
- jME 3.1 - an uncontrollable car

Test files: 
[testfiles.zip](https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/files/691376/testfiles.zip)

data.title: New Physics based jme3 example game.
data.body: single class with physics marble game example.

data.title: FBX Importer fixes and updates
data.body:
Here is the original topic: https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/fbx-importer/30309

Changes:

* Added support of FBX 2016-17 (7.5)
* Fixed rotation orders (reverse the order, use only for Lcl Rotation)
* Fixed animations transformation (proper conversion from parent space to bone space, proper use of rotation order and other transforms)
* Implemented Segment Scale Compensate property from Maya (most cases) aka InheritType
* Implemented loading bind pose from frame 0
* Properly load all animations from animation layers
* Reworked units size (still no program uses it properly to test)
* Tons of testing with animations and different models

data.title: Update AbstractAppState.java
data.body: Notify users there is an alternative to AbstractAppState.

data.title: Blender importer does not handle transformations correctly
data.body:
The Blender importer does not apply transformations, at least not rotations, to spatials and geometries consistently. 

E.g. a model of a vehicle with a 180 degree z-rotation transformation in Blender. After import, selecting the front left wheel spatial will highlight the rear right wheel. However, selecting the front left wheel geometry does highlight the correct meshes.

See: [example](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/21307972/jmonkey_rotation_problem.blend)

There is a workaround: applying all the transformations in Blender (ctrl-A).

data.title: Fixes tab stops in BitmapText / BitmapFont (3.1)
data.body:
The first explicitly set tab stop was always skipped. For all non-explicitly set tab stops it inserted a fixed spacing. This commit changes the behaviour so tabs are aligned to columns.
It also adds handling of tabs to BitmapFont.getLineWidth() which ignored tabs before.

[This was discussed in the forum.](https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/tabs-in-bitmaptext/37495).
I made a pull request so this isn't forgotten.

Explanation of changes:
- BitmapFont: Added a constant DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH. It is package private to not pollute namespace. Also added handling of tabs to getLineWidth().

- BitmapText: Only changed Javadoc. An important precondition is that the tab positions are sorted. I refrained from adding an Arrays.sort() call because the user shouldn't pay for what he doesn't need.

- LetterQuad: Removed faulty tab width calculation. It's in StringBlock now.

- StringBlock: Uses DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH constant when instantiated. Removed the getters for tabWidth/tabPos. Added calculation of tab position at the bottom. The only way "tabPos" can leave this class now is through cloning. But since the array-reference is overwritten in setTabPosition(), it can safely be shared across cloned instances. The tabPos array is cloned in the setter to prevent modifications through the original reference.

data.title: Fix some problems in issue #96 (SDK branch)
data.body: Some problems launching examples of JmeTests (described in issue [#96](https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/sdk/issues/96), SDK branch). Mostly dead links.

data.title: Linux 64bit
data.body:
`jdk/jre/bin/java
`
is not executable.
I made it work with chmod +x

data.title: recursively detects improperly modified spatials
data.body:
It will look for all improperly modified spatials and show enough information to let the developer more precisely identify the problem from [here](https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/a-more-precise-exception-report-about-modifying-the-scene-from-another-thread/34982).

Obs.: the second/newest commit is a proposal clarification method naming deprecation (so nothing will break) basically in favor of:
/* use only for debug purposes */
Spatial.getDebugName()

data.title: Fixes mouse cursor format for LWJGL3
data.body:
LWJGL3 / GLFW expects images for cursors in a different format: RGBA instead of ARGB and vertically flipped. Putting the fix in GlfwMouseInput rather than JmeCursor to preserve compatibility with LWJGL 2.

[Forum Thread](https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/mouse-cursor-flipped-and-wrong-colors/37484)

data.title: Exception on BitmapText.clone()
data.body:
Reproduce with following snippet:

```
BitmapFont font = assetManager.loadFont("Interface/Fonts/Default.fnt");
BitmapText text = new BitmapText(font);
BitmapText copy = text.clone(); // Exception thrown here
```

This worked with jme3-alpha1 and broke when I upgraded to beta1 (with the introduction of the Cloner?). The exception still happens in beta2 and the latest master branch.

The exception:
```
java.lang.RuntimeException: Error cloning object of type:class com.jme3.font.StringBlock
        at com.jme3.util.clone.Cloner.javaClone(Cloner.java:377)
        at com.jme3.util.clone.Cloner.clone(Cloner.java:260)
        at com.jme3.util.clone.Cloner.clone(Cloner.java:160)
        at com.jme3.font.BitmapText.cloneFields(BitmapText.java:98)
        at com.jme3.util.clone.Cloner.clone(Cloner.java:255)
        at com.jme3.util.clone.Cloner.clone(Cloner.java:160)
        at com.jme3.scene.Spatial.clone(Spatial.java:1360)
        at com.jme3.scene.Node.clone(Node.java:682)
        at com.jme3.scene.Node.clone(Node.java:62)
        at com.jme3.scene.Spatial.clone(Spatial.java:1448)
        at com.jme3.font.BitmapText.clone(BitmapText.java:79)
        at mygame.CloneTest.simpleInitApp(CloneTest.java:14)
        at com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication.initialize(SimpleApplication.java:220)
        at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.initInThread(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:130)
        at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.run(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:211)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalAccessException: Class com.jme3.util.clone.Cloner can not access a member of class com.jme3.font.StringBlock with modifiers "public"
        at sun.reflect.Reflection.ensureMemberAccess(Reflection.java:102)
        at java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject.slowCheckMemberAccess(AccessibleObject.java:296)
        at java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject.checkAccess(AccessibleObject.java:288)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:491)
        at com.jme3.util.clone.Cloner.javaClone(Cloner.java:375)
        ... 15 more
```

data.title: Write/read the width and height of a quad
data.body: Write the width and height of a quad on serialization. Otherwise getWidth() and getHeight() always return 0 when a quad was created from de-serialization.

data.title: Write/read the width and height of a quad (3.1)
data.body: Write the width and height of a quad on serialization. Otherwise getWidth() and getHeight() always return 0 when a quad was created from de-serialization.

data.title: Improve build scripts (master)
data.body:
- Remove SSH based maven publishing.
- Remove SDK configuration.
- Support matrix builds for Linux / OSX and JDK 8 / 7.
- Switch to Gradle 3.2.1
- Support AppVeyor for native bullet building

data.title: Cleanup build scripts (3.1)
data.body:
- Remove SSH based maven publishing.
- Remove SDK configuration.
- Support matrix builds for Linux / OSX and JDK 8 / 7.
- Fix Gradle 3.2.1 compatibility.

data.title: Fix DefineList regression
data.body: Fixes an issue where a material parameter with a 0 or 0.0 value would not be defined in the shader.
